common_issues.title: Pieces OS Login and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty logging in and linking accounts (Google, GitHub) across Pieces OS versions and platforms (Windows, Linux). Issues include infinite loading during authentication, 500 errors for `/os/sign_in`, and single account linking limitations.  Solutions involve Pieces support team debugging, log analysis, and new authentication system deployments. Users are encouraged to contact support, provide logs, and try updated versions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of Github Issue Conversation: Account Linking Issues for @johnkennyuk

**Key Points Raised:**

* @johnkennyuk experienced problems linking his personal domain (connected to Google account) with his Github account. 
* Existing account linking flow was subpar and a new system was planned for mid-late February 2025.
* @johnkennyuk preferred to keep his personal domain as the primary account. 
* Email capitalization discrepancies were suspected as a potential cause.
* @johnkennyuk confirmed the issue persisted even after troubleshooting steps.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow was difficult and prone to errors.
* Capitalized character in the registered email addresses might have caused linking issues.
* New system rollout was delayed and not yet ready for deployment.
* @johnkennyuk accidentally linked accounts in the wrong order with the new system.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Manual account merging offered by Pieces support.
* Screen recording requested from @johnkennyuk for further troubleshooting.
* Email address inconsistency resolved on Pieces side.
* Reset of @johnkennyuk's Github account for re-linking.
* New authentication system development and deployment scheduled for early/mid March 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* New authentication system is now available (April 2025).
* @johnkennyuk successfully linked his accounts using the new system but accidentally did it in the wrong order.
* @johnkennyuk is waiting for assistance to reset the account link and try again.

**Additional Notes:**

* New system rollout experienced some delays.
* Capitalization in email addresses might have contributed to initial linking issues.
* @johnkennyuk was helpful in providing information and feedback throughout the process.

**Next Steps:**

* @johnkennyuk will schedule a call to resolve the account linking order issue with Pieces support.

Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation 

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol reported an "Invalid Port" error when launching Pieces on their Windows 10 machine. 
* Uzaxirr reported experiencing the same issue.
* Zedevmed identified the problem as the lack of admin rights during installation, causing the software to fail binding to local ports.

**Problems Identified:**

* The .exe installer doesn't request admin rights, causing installation issues and the "Invalid Port" error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Zedevmed suggested installing both PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and plans to adjust the installation process.

**Current Status:**

* The Pieces team is investigating the problem further and seeking additional information from affected users.
* A fix is planned for future versions of the Pieces installation process.

**Outcome:**

* The proposed solution by Zedevmed appears to resolve the "Invalid Port" error for users facing the issue. 
* The Pieces team is working towards a permanent solution within the software itself.

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686: Database bootup issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `antoine79` experienced an issue with the initial bootup of their Pieces OS database.
* User `NidroySoft` provided detailed information about the issue, including logs and CPU specifications.

**Problems Identified:**

* User `antoine79`'s database could not be found in the expected location (`com.pieces.os/production`).
* User's CPU (Intel i7-2600) did not support the AVX2 instruction set required by the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User `antoine79` created the missing folder manually.
* The Pieces team investigated the issue and identified the core problem.
* A fix was implemented and released as version 11.3.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is resolved.
* Version 11.3.2 is live and addresses the database bootup problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* User `mark-at-pieces` communicated and assisted users `antoine79` and `NidroySoft`.
* The Pieces team actively tracked and addressed the issue efficiently.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash on Startup Due to Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Users experience application crashes upon startup, primarily on macOS and Windows systems after updating to versions 11.0.0, 11.3.0, or 11.3.1.  The crashes are related to database corruption and a missing 'database' field initialization error.  A potential solution involves updating to version 11.3.2, which includes a fix for this issue.  Additionally, creating missing folders manually might resolve the problem for some users.

## Summary of GitHub Issue #686: Database bootup issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `antoine79` experienced an issue with the initial bootup of their Pieces OS database.
* User `NidroySoft` provided detailed information about the issue, including logs and CPU specifications.

**Problems Identified:**

* User `antoine79`'s database could not be found in the expected location (`com.pieces.os/production`).
* User's CPU (Intel i7-2600) did not support the AVX2 instruction set required by the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User `antoine79` created the missing folder manually.
* The Pieces team investigated the issue and identified the core problem.
* A fix was implemented and released as version 11.3.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is resolved.
* Version 11.3.2 is live and addresses the database bootup problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* User `mark-at-pieces` communicated and assisted users `antoine79` and `NidroySoft`.
* The Pieces team actively tracked and addressed the issue efficiently.
